title: G-20 Chair Sees ‘Positive Signs’ From China on Debt Deadlock
description: China is sending encouraging signals about breaking a deadlock among global creditors over how to manage poor-country debt distress, according to an Indian official helping to lead Group of 20 efforts to resolve the crisis.

title: Trump Attorney Compelled to Testify Recuses from Mar-a-Lago Work
description: Evan Corcoran, a member of former President Donald Trump’s legal team, has stopped working on the federal criminal investigation into alleged mishandling of classified documents in light of his recent appearance before a grand jury, according to a person familiar with the situation.

title: Tim Scott Has $22 Million to Test Waters for Presidential Run
description: Senator Tim Scott of South Carolina has a nest egg that would allow him to seek the Republican nomination.

title: Battles Erupt in Sudan as Militia Fights Army to Control Nation
description: Clashes erupted across Sudan between the army and a rival paramilitary force as the two sides’ long-simmering dispute exploded into a full-blown battle for control of the North African nation.

title: India Sees Oil Cuts and War Impact as Biggest Risks to Economy
description: The biggest threats to India’s economic growth would likely come from forces outside the country, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said, citing the risk of higher oil prices and the impacts from Russia’s war in Ukraine.

title: Australia Optimistic China to End Barley, Wine Tariffs This Year
description: The Australian government is optimistic that punitive trade sanctions imposed by the Chinese government on Australia’s exports could be lifted by the end of this year, after Beijing announced a review of barley tariffs it imposed during a low-point in relations between the two countries.

title: Peterffy Pauses DeSantis Support Over Social Stances, FT Says
description: A top Republican donor said he won’t back a US presidential bid by Florida Governor Ron DeSantis because of his stance on social issues, the Financial Times reported.

title: Riot in Ecuador Prison Leaves 12 Dead, Europa Press
description: More violence in Ecuador’s biggest and most crowded prison left at least 12 people dead and three injured, Europa Press reported.

title: Trump’s Indictment Sparked $15.4 Million Fundraising Bonanza
description: Donald Trump has raised $15.4 million in the days since his unprecedented indictment by a Manhattan prosecutor, his campaign said, thanks to a surge of support from small-dollar donors.

title: German Finance Chief Says Macron Call for Autonomous EU ‘Naive’
description: German Finance Minister Christian Lindner called French President Emmanuel Macron’s call for the European Union to strive for strategic autonomy “naive,” especially given “nuclear superpower” Russia’s war in Ukraine.

title: Nigeria’s March Inflation Surges to 22% on Rising Food Costs
description: Annual inflation in Africa’s biggest economy quickened to 22% in March from 21.9% in February, according to data published on the National Bureau of Statistics’ website Saturday. The median estimate of eight economists in a Bloomberg survey was 21.8%.

title: Blinken Looks to Deepen Vietnam Ties as China Tensions Simmer
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken said the US wants to formally upgrade its relationship with Vietnam, in part to reinforce the “rules-based” order in the Indo-Pacific, as Washington continues to seek deeper ties with countries in Asia wary of China’s rise.

title: Poland Bans Ukraine Grain Imports as Farmers Protest Over Glut
description: Poland has banned imports of grains and some other food products from Ukraine to protect its market, the country’s ruling party leader Jaroslaw Kaczynski said on Saturday.

title: Arrest Made in US Leak Probe Raises Big Questions: Weekend Reads
description: US authorities arrested a 21-year-old man they believe is responsible for the biggest intelligence leak in a decade, a breach that raises questions over how such a junior military IT specialist could be allowed to do so much damage to national security.

title: ECB’s ‘Strong Consensus’ to Hike Leaves Door Open to Half-Point
description: Within a broad agreement at the European Central Bank on the need to raise interest rates further are enduring preferences among some officials for another big hike.

title: The GOP Is Making It Harder for College Students to Vote
description: Republican lawmakers are making it harder for students to cast ballots where they attend school, after the GOP suffered stinging recent electoral losses largely due to a historic surge in turnout from younger voters backing Democrats.

title: Your Saturday UK Briefing: NHS Nurses to Strike as Doctors Return
description: Follow us at  @BloombergUK and on  Facebook, and wrap up your day with The Readout newsletter with Allegra Stratton.

title: ECB’s Villeroy Repeats View That Rate-Hiking Cycle Nearing End
description: European Central Bank Governing Council member Francois Villeroy de Galhau reiterated his view that the aggressive interest rate hiking cycle needed to tamp down high euro zone inflation is nearing an end.

title: Fighting Breaks out In Sudan Between Army, Paramilitaries
description: Fighting broke out between the Sudanese army and the country’s main paramilitary group, which has gained control of Khartoum airport.

title: More Than 40 People Killed by Rebels in Congo’s East
description: KINSHASA, Congo (AP) — A rebel group in eastern Congo's Ituri province killed at least 42 people Friday, according to a civil society organization.

title: Scandal at CBI Plunges UK Business Lobby Into Existential Crisis
description: It used to have the ear of government, now some prominent members are reconsidering their membership.

title: IMF Seeks More Funding Assurances Before Pact on Pakistan Aid
description: The International Monetary Fund is seeking “necessary” financing assurances at the earliest to conclude talks with Pakistan on its stalled $6.5 billion bailout.

title: Ukraine Latest: Brazil’s Lula Tells US to Stop ‘Encouraging War’
description: Jack Teixeira, a cyber specialist for the US Air Force National Guard alleged to have accessed and leaked a massive trove of classified documents related to the Ukraine conflict, made his initial court appearance Friday in Boston federal court. Investigators are probing whether foreign adversaries played any role in the leak.

title: Credit Suisse Downfall Offers Rallying Cry for Left and Right
description: Corporate Switzerland’s darkest hour since the national airline collapsed two decades ago has given parties on the left and right the scent of an opportunity before October elections.

title: China Says Philippines’ Base Decision Stoking Taiwan Tensions
description: A Chinese envoy said the Philippines is “stoking the fire” over Taiwan’s independence by giving the US access to military sites near the Taiwan Strait under an expanded defense agreement.

title: Macron Gets Europe’s China Problem - and He’s Making It Worse
description: Germany's foreign minister gets drawn into the clean up operation after the French president’s controversial trip to Beijing

title: Germany Retires Last Nuclear Plants in Hopes of Greener Pastures
description: At 10 p.m. on Saturday, the Isar-2 nuclear plant near Munich will begin winding down its power generation in steps of 10 megawatts per minute.

title: Kishida Unhurt After Smoke Bomb Thrown During Event: NHK
description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida was unhurt after a smoke bomb was thrown at him before he was set to make a speech in Wakayama prefecture, according to national broadcaster NHK.

title: South Korea, US, Japan to Hold Regular Drills to Counter North
description: South Korea, the US and Japan will hold regular military drills as North Korea continues to develop its nuclear and missile programs despite international sanctions and pressure.

title: Trump’s Business Empire Is Worth at Least $1.2 Billion Since He Left Office
description: Former President Donald Trump values his business empire at a minimum of $1.2 billion, a federal document released Friday showed, as he cashed in from speaking engagements and ventures such as digital trading cards after he left office.

title: Australia Charges Citizen for Selling Secrets to Foreign Spies
description: An Australian man has been charged with selling information about the country’s defense and national security arrangements as well as those of other countries to two foreign spies.

title: Here Are the Candidates to Watch in Thailand’s Election
description: The race to be Thailand’s next prime minister is a crowded field with dozens of people vying for the post, but the battle is expected to be mainly between the incumbent Prayuth Chan-Ocha and Paetongtarn Shinawatra, a young politician from the storied Shinawatra clan.
